name: Carlyle Suites Hotel

reviews.text: 1. Quiet location: the Carlyle is located on a residential area, several blocks removed from the main activity of Dupont Circle. While there aren’t any restaurants or stores immediately next to the Carlyle, many options are available in several directions from the hotel.
reviews.title: Great Hotel off the beaten path.

reviews.text: 2. Tempur-Pedic Beds: the most comfortable bed of my life. Nothing more to say.
reviews.title: Funky, but nice

reviews.text: 3. Friendly staff: welcoming staff who were a delight to chat with. In a difficult situation (see below), I was accommodated.
reviews.title: Reasonably priced and convenient

reviews.text: 4. Spacious: if you are looking for a place with space and kitchenette, the Carlyle offers a rather unique setup in this area of DC. Units include a dorm-sized fridge, sink, and cooktop.
reviews.title: Quiet, friendly, cheap

likes.liked: — Spotless and large room, close to metro

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked with some trepidation, as some reviewers said the place was filthy, while others raved about it. I now have to join the "rave" category. I just spent 2 nights there at $99.00/night for a 420 sq. ft. suite, including a cute little kitchen. It was clean, comfortable, the bathroom was small but functional. I loved the Tempurpedic mattress. In fact, I think I'm going to have to buy one. I had the best 2 nights sleep that I can remember. The only drawback was the mediocre buffet breakfast, and when I got the bill, they had already added on a 15% service charge, and had the nerve to still have a blank line for me to add on a tip on my credit card bill.
reviews.title: Loved the Carlyle

reviews.text: The hotel is located about 5 blocks from the Red Line Dupont Circle Metro Station. It is surrounded by many embassies. The hotel staff was nice, and most of them spoke English. It is relatively small and there is a bar with a continental breakfast, but not really a restaurant. You will definately want to take the walk down to the Jury Hotel on New Hampshire & Dupont Circle and eat at Dupont Grille.
reviews.title: Great Dupont Circle Hotel

likes.liked: — The location, large rooms, cleanliness, quiet
likes.disliked: — No good wines at the bar - not really a full-service restaurant

reviews.title: A Bad Experience
reviews.text: The rooms have a kitchenette - but you really don't want to cook in there - it is smaller than my closet at home and you can't fit much into the mini frig and there isn't a oven - just two burners on a stove and the microwave.

It is a quiet place - we stayed over New Year's Eve and didn't get woken up - so it is a great place for small kids. Also they allow pets - large ones. We saw someone with a standard poodle and a lab owner.
reviews.title: Great amenities/location for not a lot of money!

reviews.text: Also - bring a Ethernet cable if you want access to the high speed Internet - we were able to get onto the wireless in one spot, but that was only because we were on the second floor right above the business center.
reviews.title: Good, reasonably priced option

likes.liked: — Comfortable, good location and functional kitchenette
likes.disliked: — Lacks character and room needs proper dining table

reviews.text: I just returned from a stay at the Carlyle Suites with my family. We stayed three nights in a Grand double double. The room was very spacious and the kitchen was very convenient (there is a Safeway just around the corner). The room was clean and the beds are comfortable. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. The location is great just two blocks from Dupont Circle and Embassy row. There are lots of shops and restaurants just behind the hotel. I paid $120 a night including tax. For a clean, comfortable hotel in the heart of DC I don't think you can do any better than the Carlyle Suites.
reviews.title: Great Location, Value for Money

likes.liked: — size of the rooms and cleanliness

reviews.text: The Carlyle Suites bills itself as an "art deco" hotel. Yes there is a hint of the era in the property but it's no great example of the architectural genre.
reviews.title: Nice-sized rooms but...

reviews.text: This property has spacious rooms, even a small kitchen. For families on a budget for an extended stay this may be a good choice. For the professional traveler, this hotel is not that wonderful.
reviews.title: Good value

reviews.text: My biggest criticism is the $50 charge for early check-outs. Business travelers need that flexibility and should not be penalized. I think the policy is short-sighted. I did indeed need to leave DC one day early and the charge left a sour taste in my mouth and the front desk manager told me brusquely there was no room for negotiation, even though I was giving more than 24 hours notice.
reviews.title: Great location, No A/C
Quiet hotel in lovely area
reviews.text: Without this charge, I would easily be recommending this hotel to colleagues because of its location, cost, cleanliness and free wi-fi internet. Instead I am advising my company and others I know who visit DC frequently for business to avoid this hotel. So the hotel extracted the $50 out of me but have lost potentially thousands of dollars from my colleagues and friends because of this policy.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We pretty much agree with "Unique and Very Nice" (previous review): this is a nicely kept property, an apartment building still undergoing renovations. The room is spacious and very clean. Nice to have a small, well-equipped kitchen. Tempurpedic bed was exceptionally comfortable. Rooms (and hotel itself) all done in Art Deco style, which may or may not be to your taste. The only drawbacks: furnishings in the room (i.e., chairs) not too comfortable, and poor light for reading and writing. I moved some furniture around to improve the set-up. Hotel has very few if any amenties. Neighborhood is excellent, and you're very close to Metro, Starbucks, Teaism, many restaurants. A really good choice.
reviews.title: Very good choice in Dupont/Adams Morgan neighborhood
Unique and very nice
reviews.text: This is an apartment house, that is in the process of converting to a hotel. It currently has a restaurant, and at the time we were there, there was something else under construction off the lobby. So, there was some construction mess in the lobby area, but it was kept clean during our stay. All areas of the hotel were very clean and nicely kept. The only additional amenity is access to a health spa somewhere nearby, but we never did try that.

The room was great! The room included a large bedroom-livingroom-eating area, a separate kitchen, and a bathroom. The rooms only have showers, which was somewhat of a disappointment, since we prefer a tub. Everything was emmaculately clean and very nice. We had a room on the back side, so the view was not great, but it was very quiet.
reviews.title: Quaint place to stay

description: Centrally located in fashionable Dupont Circle, Carlyle Suites Hotel in Washington DC offers 170 spacious hotel accommodations complete with full service kitchens, Tempur-Pedic beds, plush duvets and at-home amenities. All rooms feature newly installed flat screen televisions by Samsung, free WiFi, ample closet space and Eco-friendly bath amenities by Natura Resource Sweden. Carlyle Suites Hotel in Dupont Circle is also walking distance to DC's landmark neighborhoods and attractions such as Georgetown, Adams Morgan, U Street and our nations most famous residence - the White House. The DC Metro and famed Dupont Circle fountain is just a short 3 block walk from our DC hotel. Premier dining is within easy reach of the Carlyle Suites Hotel starting with Twist Dupont Restaurant and Lounge located just off our lobby and provides Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner and a very popular Sunday Brunch under a light-filled glass atrium. Come see why we rank in TripAdvisor's top 10 hotels in Washington DC!
